Text.Value: Stop right there!
Especially when one's face can be unmade so easily.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [KAYLEIGH] Dolor plunges the shears through the back of Figaro's head in a swift movement and leaves them there portruding out of Figaro's mouth.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Dolor plunges the shears through the back of Figaro's head, leaving the point protruding out of his open mouth.
EditorData.SFXTags: [KC] The shears being plunged through Figaro's head
EditorData.VFXTags: [KC] Blood as the shears are plunged through Figaro's head

EditorData.AnimationTags: [KAYLEIGH] Devella standing near Dolor, looking on paralysed.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: If Devella is alive, she will be paralized near Dolor. Should be good if we show players that Devella is here.

Text.Value: Witnesses! Sent by my lord to observe my craft.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: {scene] Dolar holds shears to Fragaros throat
Players enter in the room with no door at all.
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: NO DOOR BECAUSE PLAYERS DESTROY IT

Text.Value: I respect paralysing your target - makes the kill easier. But a monologue? Really?
'Transcend'? This brutality is a mockery of the word.
Witness my becoming!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Dolar is holding shears to Figfaros throat.

Text.Value: You talk too much. Come - meet your end, beast.
You might have blades, but I am magic incarnate. You are no match for me.
Step softly in the nearby shadows, avoiding the dwarf's gaze.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Players approach from the door that is nearer from Dolor. Will see te first nodes (until the question ones) from the door.

Text.Value: Enough of games. Enough hiding. You face me here and now.
Witnesses! Sent by my lord to observe my craft.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: {scene] Dolar holds shears to Fragaros throat

Text.Value: You see, 'Facemaker' is a bold title to give oneself, Master Figaro...

EditorData.AnimationTags: [KAYLEIGH] Dolor slowly traces the blade of the shears along Figaro's cheek and then quickly pulls them back.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Dolor traces the blade of the shears across Figaro's cheek, before pulling them back.

Text.Value: A beast on the hunt is one thing - but there's only end for one gone rabid.
This piteous hovel will be your grave challenger.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Dolar hold shears and Fiagaros throat

Text.Value: Back off. That's my kill.
But then who am I to deny the auspices of destiny? For we are celebrating, Master Figaro.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [KAYLEIGH] Dolor picks up a pair of tailor's shears from the selection of tools, weighs them up in his hand and turns back to his position behind Figaro.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [scene] He selects a pair of sizeable tailor's shears from the selection, weighing them up in his hand.

Text.Value: Witness my becoming!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Dolar is holding shears to Figfaros throat.

Text.Value: A paralysed victim and creepy monologue? Could you get any more cliche?
Together we shall transcend.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [KAYLEIGH] Dolor raises the shears toward Figaro's neck, in a threatening manner.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Dolor raises the open shears towards figaro's neck

Text.Value: A challenger. My lord tests me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Dolor is holding shears to Figaros throat

Text.Value: Razors, scissors, nail files - so many cuts one could make. And yet, such a fleeting window...

EditorData.AnimationTags: [KAYLEIGH] Dolor is running his hand over a selection of cutting implements, considering which to pick up.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Dolor runs his hand across a selection of nasty looking cutting implements that a haberdasher would own
Players approach from the door that is more far from Dolor. Will see te first nodes (until the question ones) from the door.
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: PLAYERS ENTERS USING THE FAREST DOOR

Text.Value: You have the delicious honour of being my crowning achievement. Your body is my ultimate gift to my lord Bhaal.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [KAYLEIGH] Dolor is standing behind Figaro and leans over his shoulder, close to whispering in his ear while holding up the shears.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Dolor leans in over figaro's shoulder, almost whispering this line into his ear in a reverant, zealous, semi-sensual manner

Text.Value: It's unusual for prey to supply the tools of its own butchery.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [KAYLEIGH] Dolor, while talking, is calmly pacing around Figaro who is sitting half-paralysed in his own barber chair
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [Scene] Dolor paces around a paralyzed Figaro Facemaker.

Text.Value: Keep to the shadows while the dwarf is distracted.

EditorData.stateContext: Figaro Facemaker is paralyzed on a chair in front of a mirror.

Text.Value: I loathe cowards. Come - death is too good for the likes of you.

Synopsis: Dolor Soliloquy at Figaro's, the final stage of the Serial Killer Quest just before the Murder Tribunal. Dolor has take Figaro as hostage and will say this speech if he sees the players.
